data.description: Job Description:Cambria’s internship program is a 12 week experience that successfully exposes interns to business need projects, professional development, assigned mentors and Cambria leaders. We help students identify their career interests and participate in two-way learning opportunities to develop their professional skill sets. Prepare to immerse yourself in a paid full-time, summer internship program that strives to provide cross-disciplinary work experiences. In the end, you will leave feeling accomplished, valuable and having made a difference.The Sales Operations department is looking for a Salesforce AI Analyst & Prompt Engineer Trainee/Intern to join their team in Eden Prairie, MN! Position Summary:The Salesforce AI Analyst & Prompt Engineer Trainee/Intern has two primary focus desired outcomes for this internship.  First will be to play a pivotal role representing our Sales and Sales Operations Teams, significantly contributing to cross collaboration efforts between sales team needs, marketing enablement, business operations and internal technology departments to help exponentially increase AI adoption by sales reps.  This includes documenting and prioritizing the best cases for prompt engineering opportunities in Agentforce/Salesforce that will improve sales reps efficiency and effectiveness in customer collaboration or productivity in the field. The secondary role is to help to build out the "Copilot Prompt Library and Data Resource Library" to ensure data accuracy for new prompts created based on what sales reps use today called, “The Source for Sales” as your main guide to digitizing sales reps materials into prompts and a gated data library for all approved sales or customer facing materials.   Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Complete and present a capstone project related to department business needs. This will include research, analysis, and presenting the overall findings and suggestions to peers and Cambria Leaders. Leverage your current prompt building development skills to help our internal sales operations team and our internal Cambria cross functional AI Strike team suggest, prioritize,  build and adopt the best use case scenarios that benefit our sales team adopt and use our Agents.  This will be achieved through Sales Use Case Discovery: Interviews with top-performing reps and sales leaders to identify manual tasks that can be automated via generative AI.Copilot Prompt Library: Research, test, and build a standardized library of AI prompts (in either Agentforce, Slack or our Google Suite workflows that can be  connected to our SF instances).   Examples could include creating prompt suggestions to help reps answer reporting questions quickly, draft follow-up emails or quickly research prospects with a few clicks of a button. Data Validation for AI: Perform deep-dive data audits to ensure CRM records are "AI-ready"—focusing on cleaning the specific fields that feed into AI models to prevent "garbage in, garbage out."AI Training & Documentation: Create "How-To" guides and short videos showing the sales team how to use the prompt library to save 5+ hours per week to increase adoption and awareness of how sales can leverage AI to improve efficiency in the field. Qualifications & Skills:Strong interest in Generative AI and "prompt engineering" (knowing how to talk to a bot to get the best result) while also translating the needs and requests of the sales reps in the field. A personable and curious individual who understands that the sales team's most valuable resource is time so interviews must be well prepared, focused and consistent to achieve scale quickly over the internship. Meticulous approach to data (understands that AI is only as good as the data it sits on).Creative writing and solid persona based interview capabilities and impact based communication skills.Minimum Requirements:Education: Currently pursuing a degree in Business Analytics, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field is preferred. Any technical certification from a credible AI focused, accredited training program will be considered.Experience: Hands-on experience using Generative AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini) with an understanding of prompt structures (e.g., providing context, setting personas, and defining output formats). Basic understanding of the ethics of AI, "hallucinations," and the basics of how Salesforce uses LLMs, even if you yourself have not used Salesforce prior roles. Systems: Google Suites or Excel for V-Look Up Creation, any prompt related system access, not necessary in SalesforceStand Out Applicants Could Possess:Salesforce Certified AssociateSalesforce Trailhead Badges in applicable areasAdditional Requirements:Managerial Responsibilities: NoTravel Requirements: Limited travel locally (Eden Prairie, Le Sueur, and Belle Plaine)Physical Requirements: Office position requiring telephone and computer use. Able to lift up to 20 pounds occasionally / sparingly (office supplies, packages, samples). May need to bend, reach, walk, or stoop occasionally. Prolonged periods sitting and/or standing at a desk and working on a computerProgram Dates: May 18, 2026 - August 7, 2026; M-F; 40 hour work weekTo ensure you don't miss this opportunity, it's recommended to apply as soon as possible. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until February 15, 2026, dependent on application volume, or until the position is filled. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.At Cambria, dedication to philanthropy and our people is at the heart of who we are. We strive to make a meaningful difference in the world every day by prioritizing employee well-being and fostering inclusivity and empowerment. Under the banner of CambriaCares, our philanthropic endeavors show our commitment to our people and our community to uplift kids, support education, and contribute to a sustainable future.For additional company information, please visit www.CambriaUSA.com
